articles.headline: Sperm Banks Accused of Losing Samples and Lying About Donors
articles.snippet: One lawsuit, by a California woman, claims a Los Angeles fertility center lost her late husband’s banked sperm, denying her the ability to have his children.
articles.abstract: One lawsuit, by a California woman, claims a Los Angeles fertility center lost her late husband’s banked sperm, denying her the ability to have his children.
articles.lead_paragraph: MONTECITO, Calif. — Even as she mourned the death of her 29-year-old husband from a rare genetic disorder, Sarah Robertson was comforted by knowing that six vials of his sperm were safely stored at the Reproductive Fertility Center — in Tank B, Canister 5, Cane G, Position 6, Color Blue — waiting until she was ready to have the baby they had both longed for.

articles.headline: Roger Ailes Leaves Fox News, and Rupert Murdoch Steps In
articles.snippet: Mr. Murdoch himself broke the news to staff members in New York, barely two weeks after Mr. Ailes was named in a sexual harassment suit.
articles.abstract: Mr. Murdoch himself broke the news to staff members in New York, barely two weeks after Mr. Ailes was named in a sexual harassment suit.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the dark for days, Fox News staffers finally got word on Thursday about the future of their network.
articles.byline: By John Koblin, Emily Steel and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Roger Ailes Fused TV With Politics, Changing Both
articles.snippet: With Fox News, Mr. Ailes changed and shaped what we talk about when we talk about news and government.
articles.abstract: With Fox News, Mr. Ailes changed and shaped what we talk about when we talk about news and government.
articles.lead_paragraph: Roger Ailes has died at 77. This assesment of his career by our chief television critic was originally published in July 2016, following the departure of Mr. Ailes from Fox News.

articles.headline: His Tone Dark, Donald Trump Takes G.O.P. Mantle
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination with an unusually vehement appeal to Americans who feel that their country is spiraling out of control.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination with an unusually vehement appeal to Americans who feel that their country is spiraling out of control.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Donald John Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination on Thursday night with an unusually vehement appeal to Americans who feel that their country is spiraling out of control and yearn for a leader who will take aggressive, even extreme, actions to protect them.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Chasing Pokémon, a Baby Step Toward Virtual Reality
articles.snippet: With a charged cellphone in hand, a reporter joins San Francisco’s first large planned Pokémon Go event.
articles.abstract: With a charged cellphone in hand, a reporter joins San Francisco’s first large planned Pokémon Go event.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In this season of random assassinations and political uproar, who could resist the temptation to supplement a high-strung and frightening reality with some gentle make-believe?

articles.headline: F.C.C. Backs Swedish Company to Run American Phone Routing System
articles.snippet: Major wireless carriers pushed for Telcordia because of the cost savings, but some intelligence officials have raised national security concerns.
articles.abstract: Major wireless carriers pushed for Telcordia because of the cost savings, but some intelligence officials have raised national security concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Communications Commission has decided to make a European-owned company the clearinghouse for routing billions of cellphone calls and text messages across the United States, despite claims by critics that the plan poses national security risks, officials said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Escape His Caricature? Donald Trump Passes Up the Chance
articles.snippet: To an electorate that remains anxious about his demeanor, his honesty and his character, Mr. Trump offered no acknowledgment, no rebuttal, no explanation.
articles.abstract: To an electorate that remains anxious about his demeanor, his honesty and his character, Mr. Trump offered no acknowledgment, no rebuttal, no explanation.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — It was Donald J. Trump’s best chance to escape his own caricature.

articles.headline: Why Companies Have Started to Coach New Parents
articles.snippet: A growing number of companies are offering transition coaching and more generous policies in an effort to retain female employees.
articles.abstract: A growing number of companies are offering transition coaching and more generous policies in an effort to retain female employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: [The topics new parents are talking about. Evidence-based guidance. Personal stories that matter. Sign up now to get NYT Parenting in your inbox every week.]
